description: A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws.
A large, powerful cat that has a yellowish-brown coat, with the male typically having a mane of long hair.
A large cat with a yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to the forests of Asia.
A very large plant-eating mammal with a prehensile trunk, long curved ivory tusks, and large ears.
A large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches.
A primate, often with a long tail, typically living in trees in tropical countries.
A large plant-eating domesticated mammal with solid hoofs and a flowing mane and tail.
A fully grown female animal of a domesticated breed of ox, kept to produce milk or beef.
A domesticated ruminant animal with a thick woolly coat, kept in flocks for its wool or meat.
A hardy domesticated ruminant animal that has backward-curving horns and (in the male) a beard.
An omnivorous domesticated hoofed mammal with sparse bristly hair and a flat snout.
A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.
A waterbird with a broad flat bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait.
A large bird of prey with a massive hooked bill and long broad wings.
A nocturnal bird of prey with large forward-facing eyes surrounded by facial disks.
A long limbless reptile which has no eyelids, a short tail, and jaws that are capable of considerable extension.
A large predatory semiaquatic reptile with long jaws, long tail, short legs, and a horny textured skin.
A slow-moving reptile, enclosed in a scaly or leathery domed shell into which it can retract its head and thick legs.
A tailless amphibian with a short squat body, moist smooth skin, and very long hind legs for leaping.
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water.
A long-bodied chiefly marine fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, a prominent dorsal fin, and toothlike scales.
A small gregarious toothed whale with a beaklike snout and a curved fin on the back.
A very large marine mammal with a streamlined hairless body, a horizontal tail fin, and a blowhole on top of the head for breathing.
A nectar-feeding insect with two pairs of large, typically brightly colored wings that are covered with microscopic scales.
A winged insect that collects nectar and pollen, produces wax and honey, and lives in large communities.
A small insect typically living in a highly organized colony with a division of labor for males, females, and workers.
An eight-legged predatory arachnid with an unsegmented body consisting of a fused head and thorax and a rounded abdomen.
A wild carnivorous mammal which is the largest member of the dog family.
A carnivorous mammal with a pointed muzzle and bushy tail, known for its cunning.
A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a very short tail, walking on the soles of its feet.
A hoofed grazing or browsing animal, with branched bony antlers that are shed annually.
A small mammal with long ears, long hind legs, and a short tail, living in burrows.
An agile tree-dwelling rodent with a bushy tail, typically feeding on nuts and seeds.
A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs.
A flightless bird of the southern hemisphere, with black upper parts and white underparts.
A large, long-necked ungulate mammal with one or two humps on its back.
An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane.
A large thick-skinned semiaquatic African mammal, with massive jaws and large tusks.
A large, heavily built plant-eating mammal with one or two horns on the nose and thick folded skin.
A powerfully built great ape with a large head and short neck, found in the forests of central Africa.
A great ape with large ears, mainly black coloration, and lighter skin on the face.
A bird, often vividly colored, with a short downcurved hooked bill, grasping feet, and a raucous voice.
A large waterbird with a long flexible neck, short legs, webbed feet, a broad bill, and typically all-white plumage.
A male bird with very long tail feathers that can be erected and expanded in display.
A nocturnal flying mammal that navigates by echolocation and feeds on insects or fruit.
A fish-eating aquatic mammal with a streamlined body and feet developed as flippers.
A cephalopod mollusk with eight sucker-bearing arms, a soft sac-like body, and strong beak-like jaws.
A large marine crustacean with a cylindrical body, stalked eyes, and five pairs of legs.
A crustacean with a broad carapace, stalked eyes, and five pairs of legs, the first pair of which are modified as pincers.
